availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald B. Ficklin (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Ficklin and Frances "Fannie" Walker Ficklin. Married to Elizabeth Johnson Ficklin in Powell County, Kentucky, on January 1, 1852. Father of William N. Ficklin, Sarah E. Ficklin, Millard F. Ficklin, Henrietta Ficklin, George Ficklin, and Grant Ficklin. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 68A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 11.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Audrain County, Saling Township, p. 620A.
"Archie Ficklin Dead," Mexico Weekly Ledger (Mexico, MO), February 14, 1901, p. 3.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Powell County Marriages.
History of Audrain County, Missouri, (St. Louis, MO: National Historical Company, 1884), pp. 879-880.
"Archie B. Ficklin (1825-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial 52138868, Accessed August 4, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52138868.
